page.title: 09Cold Norton Primary School.
page.content: Cold Norton Primary School; stands near the centre of the village in St Stephen's Road, and has , in 1985, 125 children attending between the ages of 4 and 11. There are at present five classes. It is an interesting building constructed in three different stages, the oldest part having been built in 1914 and the newest part which includes the school hall having been finished only last year. The School has a family atmosphere where the teachers and the children usually get on well together and try to help each other wherever possible. Children here are never smacked or hit by the teachers but they are expected to behave well and to have good manners both to teachers and to each other. Often children will visit other schools or places of interest.
